http_exceptions.title: 400 Bad Request
http_exceptions.headline: Invalid request data
http_exceptions.description: The server cannot process the request due to client error.

http_exceptions.title: 401 Unauthorized
http_exceptions.headline: Authentication required
http_exceptions.description: The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

http_exceptions.title: 403 Forbidden
http_exceptions.headline: Access is denied
http_exceptions.description: The server understands the request but refuses to authorize it.

http_exceptions.title: 404 Not Found
http_exceptions.headline: Resource does not exist
http_exceptions.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

http_exceptions.title: 405 Method Not Allowed
http_exceptions.headline: Incorrect HTTP method
http_exceptions.description: The request method is known by the server but is not supported for the resource.

http_exceptions.title: 408 Request Timeout
http_exceptions.headline: Client took too long
http_exceptions.description: The server timed out waiting for the request.

http_exceptions.title: 409 Conflict
http_exceptions.headline: Conflict with resource state
http_exceptions.description: The request conflicts with the current state of the target resource.

http_exceptions.title: 410 Gone
http_exceptions.headline: Resource removed
http_exceptions.description: The requested resource is no longer available and will not be available again.

http_exceptions.title: 413 Payload Too Large
http_exceptions.headline: Request body too large
http_exceptions.description: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

http_exceptions.title: 415 Unsupported Media Type
http_exceptions.headline: Media type not supported
http_exceptions.description: The server refuses to process the request because of an unsupported format.

http_exceptions.title: 422 Unprocessable Entity
http_exceptions.headline: Validation error
http_exceptions.description: The request is well-formed but contains semantic errors.

http_exceptions.title: 429 Too Many Requests
http_exceptions.headline: Rate limit exceeded
http_exceptions.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given time.

http_exceptions.title: 500 Internal Server Error
http_exceptions.headline: Server-side error
http_exceptions.description: The server encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

http_exceptions.title: 502 Bad Gateway
http_exceptions.headline: Invalid response from upstream
http_exceptions.description: The server received an invalid response from the upstream server.

http_exceptions.title: 503 Service Unavailable
http_exceptions.headline: Server overloaded or under maintenance
http_exceptions.description: The server cannot handle the request due to overload or maintenance.

http_exceptions.title: 504 Gateway Timeout
http_exceptions.headline: Upstream server timeout
http_exceptions.description: The server did not receive a timely response from another server.

http_methods.title: GET
http_methods.headline: Retrieve data
http_methods.description: Used to request data from a specified resource.

http_methods.title: POST
http_methods.headline: Create a resource
http_methods.description: Sends data to create a new resource on the server.

http_methods.title: PUT
http_methods.headline: Replace a resource
http_methods.description: Updates or replaces a resource entirely.

http_methods.title: PATCH
http_methods.headline: Partially update a resource
http_methods.description: Applies partial modifications to a resource.

http_methods.title: HEAD
http_methods.headline: Retrieve headers only
http_methods.description: Like GET but retrieves only headers, no body.

http_methods.title: OPTIONS
http_methods.headline: Retrieve supported methods
http_methods.description: Used to describe the communication options for the target resource.

http_methods.title: TRACE
http_methods.headline: Debugging request
http_methods.description: Echoes the received request for debugging purposes.
